intro: Tissa mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican tissa, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Tissa mexicana typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in dry, hot climates. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to local biodiversity.
